Module WitchHunt
Package fr.sos.witchhunt.view.std

Class StdPlayerCreator

java.lang.Object
fr.sos.witchhunt.view.std.StdPlayerCreator
All Implemented Interfaces:
InputSource, Runnable, Callable<Player>
public class StdPlayerCreator extends Object implements Runnable, Callable<Player>, InputSource

Used to create one instance of Player based on standard input.

A specific class is required as the protocol is different from the one used for the the GUI : it is sequential, several answers have to be provided in a defined order. - If the minimum players count is already reached, do you want to add one more ? - Should this player be human-controlled ? - If yes, how should we call them ?

At the same time an input Consumer and a Producer (see InputSource) : Standard-input is collected using a slave input mediator to control an instance of InterruptibleStdInput. A Player is therefore instantiated based on the required information, then, post(Player) to the master input mediator.

Started into a Thread which can be interrupted.

In concurrence with PlayerCreatorController (Controller for the graphical players creation interface). The first one to send a non-null instance of Player rules and provokes its concurrent's interruption.

See Also:
  • InputSource
  • InputMediator
  • InputMediator::createPlayer(int, List, boolean)
  • Player
  • Tabletop is the starting point of players creation
  • in concurrence with PlayerCreatorController (Controller for the graphical players creation interface).

    private StdView
    console
    The console view, used for displaying prompts and error messages related to the input requests.

    The master input mediator, to which the created Player is sent. Acts as an input Consumer.
    private boolean
    optional
    true if the minimum players count has been reached, as the creation of a player is not mandatory.
    private int
    playerId
    The id of the potential future player.
    private InputMediator
    slaveInputMediator
    The slave input mediator, from which user-input is collected in order to create a Player on its basis.
    private List<String>
    takenNames
    The list of all already-taken player names.

    • call

      public Player call() throws InterruptedException

      Tries creating a player based on a sequence of several input requests. : - If optional, do you want to add one more one more player or do you prefere starting the game right now ? - Should this player be human-controlled ? - If yes, how should we call them ?

      Checks for the validity of provided information.

      Specified by:
      call in interface Callable<Player>
      Returns:
      The Player created on the basis of the provided information, or null if it was interrupted.
      Throws:
      InterruptedException
